description: Platform for managing educational escape rooms

timeline.openDoor: The team has successfully finished the escape room

timeline.failedToSolve: Failed attempt to solve the puzzle
timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.puzzleExplanation: The timeline shows the puzzles each team of participants were working on at every instant of the escape room. For each solved puzzle, the number of minutes it took each team to solve it is displayed. If a puzzle does not have a number on top, it means that participants did not manage to solve it.

api.name: Name
api.authentication: Whether the authentication parameters are correct or not
api.authenticationAPIDesc: This endpoint allows you to authenticate in escapp and verify whether you are allowed to participate in an escape room at a given time
api.tokenR: Instead of the password you can provide the user token
api.puzzleAPIDesc: This endpoint allows you to solve puzzles remotely without a need to access escapp's team interface
api.startAPIDesc: This endpoint allows you to start participating in an escape room without a need to hit the start button in escapp
api.erState: Object indicating the current state of the escape room for the team. It has two properties: puzzlesSolved, which contains an array indicating which puzzles have been completed by the team (including the puzzle's name, number, solution, and success message); hintsAllowed, a boolean indicating whether the team can request any more hints; progress, the percentage of puzzles solved, and score, the total score of the participant according to the grading rubric set up by the teacher.

code.OK: The answer provided for the puzzle is correct
code.NOK: The answer provided for the puzzle is incorrect

api.correctAnswer: Boolean whose value is true if the answer provided for the puzzle is correct and false otherwise.

evaluation.eachHint: Penalty or reward for requesting a hint
evaluation.eachHintObtain: Penalty or reward for each hint obtained
evaluation.eachPuzzle: Percentage of the grade assigned to each puzzle
evaluation.forSurveys: create surveys and quizes for your escape room
evaluation.hintSuccess: Points for each hint request succeeded
evaluation.hintFailed: Points for each hint request failed
evaluation.justParticipating: Percentage of the grade assigned solely for participating
evaluation.gradingIntro: Here you can set up the rubric to grade participants and choose how their participation will be recorded.
evaluation.title: Evaluation
evaluation.automaticAttendance: Participation record. When a participant accesses the escape room during their turn
evaluation.automaticAttendanceParticipant: Participation is recorded automatically for the participant
evaluation.automaticAttendanceTeam: Participation is recorded automatically for the participant and their teammates
evaluation.allowUserToResetTeamProgress: Allow participants to reset their own team progress
evaluation.allowUserToResetTeamProgressHint: When students reset their progress, all information related to their previous attempt (answers, hints used, time, etc.) is permanently deleted.

hints.correctNumberPlaceHolder: How many correct answers do participants need to obtain a hint?
hints.moodleXMLExplanation: If you want participants to answer a series of questions to obtain a hint, upload a MoodleXML file that includes a battery of questions
hints.explanation: In this step you can select the hint strategy of your escape room. There are three strategies available: not allowing hints, allowing free hints, and requiring participants to solve a quiz in order to obtain a hint. If you enable hints, you can set a limit of hints that participants can obtain. If you choose the last strategy, you need to upload a MoodleXML file containing a battery of questions and indicate how many questions will be shown each attempt, how many they need to get right in order to pass, and whether the right answer should be shown to them after each attempt.
hints.moodleExplanation: If you want participants to answer a quiz in order to get a hint, please upload a MoodleXML with a battery of questions
hints.feedbackExplanation: Do you want to show participants the correct answers once the quiz is completed?
hints.allowCustomHintsExplanation: If you check this option, when a team runs out of automatic hints, they will be told to ask the teacher for help instead. If not checked, participants will not be able to request hints when they run out.
hints.hintIntervalExplanation: How much time (in minutes) do participants need to wait before asking for a new hint?
hints.hintLimitExplanation: What is the maximum number of hints participants can get?
hints.quizHintsStrategy: Students can obtain hints by passing a quiz
hints.automatedHintsExplanation: You can choose for participants to receive automatic help if they get stuck on a puzzle longer than the estimated duration from the previous step
hints.automatedSuggestions: Send a message to participants suggesting them to request a hint if they exceed the estimated duration on a specific puzzle
hints.automatedHints: Send a hint automatically if participants exceed the estimated duration on a specific puzzle
hints.noFile: You haven't uploaded any files yet
hints.questionNumberExplanation: Questions will be randomly picked from the MoodleXML file
hints.questionNumberPlaceHolder: How many questions per attempt do you want?
hints.title: Hint management

team.explanation: In this section, you must create the content that participants will see on their screens while playing the escape room. You can use the resource catalog located below this text to upload files and create interactive elements.
team.placeholder: In this content block, you can add text, images, links, and other types of resources. You can configure when this content block will be visible during the escape room by clicking the settings icon located on the left.
team.title: Team interface

class.explanation: Here you can customize the interface that you'll be able to screen in the classroom for all participants to see. It can include a countdown, an introductory video, a leaderboard, etc. If the escape room is conducted remotely, the participants will never see the class interface, so you can skip this step.
class.placeholder: Add the information you want to project in the classroom
class.title: Classroom interface

indications.explanation: Here you can customize the information participants will see prior to the start of the escape room since the moment the sign up. For instance, you can remind them to bring certain material, tell them to review the course content, or provide them a video to watch.
indications.title: Pre-activity instructions
indications.hybridInstructionsNote: You have indicated that the escape room is hybrid, please upload here any additional resources that participants will need to complete the activity.

front.areYouSureDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this content block? This action cannot be reverted

table.name: Name

config.name: Name
config.warningPuzzleChange: If you have changed your puzzle solution you must save this form first for your changes to be available in the preview

puzzles.explanation: In this step, you can specify the different puzzles that make up the escape room. Keep in mind that they must follow a linear structure, which means that, in order to solve a puzzle, participants need to have solved the previous one. You need to specify the name and description of each puzzle, as well as its solution. If you enable the automatic monitoring option for a puzzle, it won't be possible to solve it in the team interface. Instead, it must be completed through an application that uses the Escapp API. You can add hints for each puzzle and these hints will be provided to participants based on the hint configuration you set in the next step.
puzzles.calculateDurationTitle: Calculate the expected duration based on previous data from participants who have completed this puzzle
puzzles.expectedDurationPlaceholder: How long will it take participants to solve this puzzle?
puzzles.noPuzzlesYet: You haven't defined any puzzles yet
puzzles.notYet: Please create a new puzzle before assigning it any hints
puzzles.title: Puzzles

errors.durationCalculationNotEnough: Error calculating expected duration. Not enough data

after.title: Post-activity instructions
after.explanation: Here you can add the information you want to show participants once they finish the escape room. You can include a survey, a post-quiz, or any other information you want to share with them.
after.placeholder: Add custom instructions for after the escape room

sharing.title: Publication
sharing.description: You need to publish the escape room so participants can sign up and play. To publish it, you must choose a license and set its visibility (public or unlisted).
sharing.licenseExplanation: Under which license do you want to publish your escape room?
sharing.licenseExplanationAlreadyPublished: You cannot change the license anymore since your escape room has already been published before.
sharing.invitationExplanation: Do you want participants to enter a password to join the escape room? If so, enter it in the text field below.
sharing.instructionsExplanation: Share any instructions you want with teachers who use your escape room. Upload a PDF file. You can include information about how to play, how to evaluate, etc.
sharing.scopeExplanation: You can choose between two visibility options for your escape room: public and unlisted. Escape rooms with public visibility may appear on the platform’s homepage, and any user can join and play them at any time. Escape rooms with unlisted visibility do not appear on the homepage and can only be joined by students through a direct link. In these escape rooms, you can also set a password for access. All escape rooms, regardless of their visibility setting, can be accessed by platform administrators and used according to their license.
sharing.statusExplanation: Have you finished creating the escape room? If so, select the completed option. Otherwise, select draft, and you can continue editing it later. Keep in mind that until you publish it, participants will not be able to join. Once published, you will not be able to change the license.
sharing.areYouSureUnpublish: Are you sure you want to unpublish the escape room and revert it to draft status? If you do, new participants will no longer be able to access it.
sharing.areYouSurePublish: Are you sure you want to publish the escape room? Your license cannot be changed once published
sharing.areYouSurePublishBefore: Are you sure you want to publish the escape room?

checklist.step3: At least one hint defined (or disabled hints)
checklist.congrats: Congratulations! You've successfully published your escape room.
checklist.congrats2: Create a shift so participants can sign up for the escape room.
checklist.backToDraft: Do you want to go back to draft? To do so, click on the switch.
checklist.areYouReady: Have you finished creating your escape room? Make it public by flipping the switch! Keep in mind that once it's published, you won’t be able to change its license. Before publishing, you can test it on your own or invite collaborators to try it out as a group.
checklist.stillInfoNeeded: You still have some mandatory information that you need to complete before making your escape room public.
checklist.warningAboutLicense: Once you publish your escape room, you will not be able to change the license. Once you are ready, click on the switch.

sharing.warningOldEscapeRooms:
We have a new version of Escapp!
In this version, you need to change the status from draft to published in order to make your escape room accessible to the students.

If you make changes to the escape room, it will need to be re-verified before network participants can play the updated version.

inspiration.intro:
You don't know how to start creating the escape room?
Follow these steps
inspiration.title: Escape room setting up guide

first.title: Step 1: Establish the general approach
first.intro: A good way to start designing an educational escape room is to establish how the activity will fit within the subject and thus be able to correctly size the activity.

list.fourth: During class time or outside of this
list.sixth: Resources needed: physical space, use of special material, budget...

second.title: Paso 2: >Step 3: Choose the puzzles
second.intro: Once the activity is defined in the context of the subject in which it will be developed, it is necessary to define what specific contents will cover the escape room. As it happens in any other didactic activity. It is recommended to first establish some general objectives and then break them down into more specific objectives that participants must achieve to overcome the activity.

third.title: Paso 3: Escoger los retos
third.intro: Based on the objectives established in the previous step, it is necessary to identify the appropriate way to test participants' knowledge, combining tasks that involve the practical application of the skills acquired in the subject with theoretical knowledge. The challenges that participants face are highly dependent on the subject in which the activity is framed.
third.middle: Some examples of these resources are shown below.

list.assembly: Form the parts of an object

third.resources: Here you can access some resources.

fourth.title: Step 4: Select an appropriate theme
fourth.intro: The theme is one of the key pieces that differentiates an escape room from a common practical exercise. It is about the story that surrounds the whole experience and that provides the immersive character of the game. It gives meaning to the tasks that participants must perform during the escape room and cohesion all the tests of the activity. When you develop the theme you have to take into account:

list.first: The narrative, the temporal and spatial context
list.second: The student profile to which it is addressed
list.third: Consistency between the theme and the chosen challenges
list.fourth: Include the time factor on the subject

fourth.booksAndMovies: A good source of inspiration for selecting a theme is books, video games, famous movies or series, since it is likely that participants know the plot or the characters beforehand. Of course, the subject in which the escape room is framed will have a great influence on the selection of the theme, since the challenges to overcome must be supported by the narrative. Some examples of themes are:

fifth.title: Step 5: Build challenges, tracks and other materials
fifth.intro: Finally, with the design of the escape room and the available resources in mind, it is time to start building all the pieces.

puzzles.title: Puzzles
puzzles.content: To build challenges it is common to use physical resources such as locks, keys, boxes, laboratory equipment, puzzles, etc. However, an escape room in which many students participate simultaneously, these types of resources can greatly increase the budget required for the activity. One solution is to combine simple physical resources (paper, for example) with free digital resources: mobile applications, sounds, virtual puzzles, etc. You will find examples and resources in step 3.

hints.title: Hints
hints.content: An essential part in the design of all escape rooms are the clues and aids It is essential to avoid that participants spend too much time in the same challenge because, if this happens, there is a risk that In addition, this situation can be counterproductive from a pedagogical point of view, since participants will not face all the challenges.To prevent the request for help from being constant, one possibility is to devise a battery of questions Students have to try to answer each time they need a clue, and if they can guess more than a certain number of questions, they will get a clue, in this way participants will earn the right to get help and their theoretical knowledge is tested. of the subject to complement the practical content that is put into practice in the escape room.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.intro: Before starting the development of the activity, it is important to present the game to the participants, it is important to clarify what the limits of the activity are, if they can leave the room, if they can use their mobile devices, if they can talk with the other teams, etc. Then, they are introduced to the theme presenting the goal to be achieved in the escape room and giving indications of where to start, this can be done in the form of video message in which a character (either the teacher or an “actor”) appeals to participants to help solve a mystery, crime, enigma, etc. You can also approach from the opposite perspective, showing a video in the that the character plays a villain role that threatens the participants.

sixth.title: Step 6: Test the escape room
sixth.intro: Detecting and fixing errors is crucial to the success of an educational escape room, since the presence of a failure could have catastrophic consequences in the development of the activity. It is necessary to test the challenges first individually and then perform a complete simulation.

seventh.title: Step 7: Develop a way to evaluate the experience
seventh.intro: There are several ways to evaluate if the participants have learned doing the activity, one way is through a control group, comparing the notes of the students who made the escape room with those who did not. at the beginning of the escape room and at the end, checking if there has been a significant increase in the knowledge of the participants Finally, at the end of the activity it is convenient to conduct a survey to know the opinion of the participants about the escape room.

delete.deleteYourAccountMsg: If you choose to delete your account, all personal information associated with it will be permanently removed from our system. Nonetheless, your past participation data will remain in anonymized form to be used for the purposes indicated in our privacy policy. This means that while your contributions will still help improve our platform, they will no longer be linked to you in any way. Anyways, we would be sorry to see you go.

Common.BackgroundURLPlaceholder: You can enter the URL of any image from your resource catalog
Common.soundURLPlaceholder: You can enter the URL of any audio file from your resource catalog
Common.warningPuzzleLink: This puzzle is currently linked to another resource

Keypad.name: Keypad
Keypad.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to enter a specific sequence of numbers, letters, colors, or symbols using a keypad.

DecoderDisk.name: Decoder disk
DecoderDisk.description: This resource allows you to create a decoder disk with multiple wheels, where each wheel can contain numbers, letters, colors, or symbols. The disk can be linked to an escape room puzzle and its solution.

Safebox.name: Safe box
Safebox.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle in which participants must open a safe box by turning a dial multiple times following a specific sequence.

Switches.name: Switches
Switches.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to activate a specific set of switches. Optionally, each switch can be associated with a number, a letter, a symbol, or a color.

WireConnection.name: Wire connection
WireConnection.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to connect source and destination nodes with wires in a specific way. The wires can have different colors and, optionally, each node (source or destination) can be associated with a number, a letter, or a symbol.

SignalGenerator.name: Signal generator
SignalGenerator.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to use a device to generate an electrical signal with a specified waveform, frequency (F), amplitude (A), and phase (φ).

Chessboard.name: Chessboard
Chessboard.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to perform a specific sequence of chess piece moves.

HiddenPath.name: Hidden path
HiddenPath.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to follow a specific path on a grid.

BasicTextBox.name: Basic Text Box
BasicTextBox.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to enter a specific text into a text input.

ItemSelection.name: Item Selection
ItemSelection.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to select a series of items from a given set on one or more occasions.

Clock.name: Clock
Clock.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to set a specific time on a clock.

Jigsaw.name: Jigsaw
Jigsaw.description: This resource allows you to create an escape room puzzle whose solution requires participants to complete a jigsaw puzzle by placing each fragment of a given image in its correct position.
Jigsaw.solutionImageReverse: Reverse side of the solution image

WiredBomb.name: Wired Bomb
WiredBomb.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to defuse a bomb by cutting a series of wires in a specific order.

Login.name: Login
Login.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to log in using a username and/or a password.

Video.name: Video
Video.description: This resource allows you to create a puzzle whose solution requires participants to watch a specific video.

SQLChallenge.name: SQL Challenge
SQLChallenge.description: This resource allows you to create a challenge whose solution requires participants to run SQL queries against a given database.
SQLChallenge.dbUrlPlaceholder: Enter the URL of any sqlite database
SQLChallenge.title: Title
SQLChallenge.titlePlaceholder: The title that will be shown in the challenge
SQLChallenge.question: Question
SQLChallenge.questionPlaceholder: The question participants must answer using SQL
SQLChallenge.initialQueryPlaceholder: SQL query that will be shown initially to participants
SQLChallenge.resultsPlaceholderDefault: The results will be shown here
SQLChallenge.testsPlaceholderDefault: Run the query to see the test results
